intro: Pavetta lynesii, commonly known as the Lynes' pavetta, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are usually dark green and glossy. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are often fragrant. Pavetta lynesii is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
